properties.entry: License GPLv3+: GNU GPL version 3 or later <http://gnu.org/licenses/gpl.html> This is free software: you are free to change and redistribute it. There is NO WARRANTY, to the extent permitted by law.

Helper application for the glossaries-extra package. The aux file should either be in the current directory or in the directory specified by {0}. Bib files can either be relative to the directory the aux file is in or in a location that can be found by kpsewhich.
{1}, {0} Display this help message and exit.
{1}, {0} <lang> Use language resource file for <lang> and identify this as the default document language.
{0} <name> Set the character encoding for the glg and glstex output files and the aux and log input files.
{0} <name> Set the character encoding for the log input file.
{0} <name> Set the default character encoding for all input and output files.
{0} Interpret tilde character as normal space.
{0} Obey known category code changing commands encountered in the aux file.
{1}, {0} <list> Instruct interpreter to assume the listed packages have been used in the document. (The packages must be known by the interpreter.)
{1}, {0} <list> Don''t check the log file for the listed packages.
{0} <list> Instruct the interpreter to parse the listed packages.
{0} List the packages known to the interpreter and exit.
{0} Text superscripts or subscripts will use Unicode superscript or subscript characters if possible.
{0} Collapse explicit location ranges with coincident end-points.
{0} Retain non-identical locations with the given formats even if a partial match exists.
{0} <rule> Rule for merging locations with record=nameref. <rule> may be one of: ''hcounter'', ''href'', ''title'' or ''location''.
{1}, {0} Add record count fields to entries.
{1}, {0} Add unit record count fields to entries.
{0} Warn if internal non-bib fields are found in bib file.
{0} Warn if unknown entry types are found in bib file.
{1}, {0} <fields>|"all" Insert an empty group if fields start with certain problematic commands to protect against case-changing commands like \Gls.
{0} Switch on the auto-insertion of an empty group for math-shift ($).

{0} <option> Check for the shortcut commands when searching for dependencies. Permitted values of <option>: ''ac'', ''acronyms'' (or ''acro''), ''abbreviations'' (or ''abbr''), ''all'' (or ''true''), ''none'' (or ''false'')
{0} <list>|"none" Check each field listed in <list> for potentially problematic nested link text.
{0} Trim leading and trailing spaces from fields.
{0} <list> Only trim leading and trailing spaces from listed fields. (Cumulative.)
{0} <list> Trim leading and trailing spaces from all fields except those listed. (Cumulative.)
{0} Allow field expansion to occur when LaTeX inputs the glstex file.
Selecting entry {0} (has one or more records).
Selecting entry {0} (dual {1} has one or more records).
Checking entry {0} field {1} for date/time data (date:{2}, time:{3}).
Adding entry {0} to secondary list (no filter).
Checking entry {0} admission to secondary list. Match action: {1}. Matches: {2}.
Entry ''{0}'' has already been added, ignoring. (Original entry: @{1}{2}. This entry: @{3}{4})
Cross-resource references disabled. (Use {0} to override if required.)
Cross-resource references can''t be supported for resource set {0}.
Sort value ''{0}'' (entry ''{1}'') not unique for the entry''s hierarchical level.
Appending suffix ''{0}'' to the sort value ''{1}'' for entry ''{2}''.
Entry type ''{0}'' has no fallback for field: {1}
Inconsistent location format {0} with range started by {1}
Inserting empty group in front of {0} to protect it from mfirstuc.
Calculating width of name field for entry ''{0}''
No sentence case protection required now
Default setting {0} now applied, use {1} to revert
Unable to detect character encoding for TeX file. Defaulting to: {0}. (Use {1} if this is incorrect.)
Adding record {0} to entry {1}''s record list.
Adding primary record {0} to entry {1}''s record list.
Adding supplemental record {0} to entry {1}''s record list.
Adding record {0} to entry {1}''s {2} record list.
Adding primary record {0} to entry {1}''s {2} record list.
Copying record {0} from entry {1} to entry {2}.
Copying primary record {0} from entry {1} to entry {2}.
Attempt to copy record to self for entry {2} ignored.
Converting empty location to ignored record (label: ''{0}'', counter: ''{1}'', encap: ''{2}'')
Removing ''{0}'' because it has records (''{1}={2}'' in effect).
Not flattening entry ''{0}'' because entry ''{1}'' depends on parent ''{2}''
Entry ''{0}'' missing sort field ''{1}''. Falling back on field ''{2}''.
Support may be quite limited in some cases.
Not appending anything for prefix field ''{0}'' (ends with exception character code {1})
Not appending anything for prefix field ''{0}'' (ends with exception control sequence \{1})
Appending {0} for prefix field ''{1}'' (''{2}'' doesn''t fit exception rules)
Append nbsp for prefix field ''{0}'': matched ''{1}'' in ''{2}'' (pattern ''{3}'')
Calculating field exclusion list for entry {0}
Element ''{0}'' in compound entry ''{1}'' has not been selected
% This file was created by {0} v{1} on {2}.
% This file was created by {0} v{1}.
% DO NOT edit this file. Any changes made will be lost next time {0} is run.
% This file was generated from data obtained from the following files:
Private entry type ''{0}'' found. Did you mean ''{1}''?
Found internal non bib-field ''{0}'' in ''{1}.bib'' file for entry ''{2}''. Unexpected results may occur.
Entry {0} is being defined in {1} but it has already been defined in a previous .glstex file.
Entry ''{0}'' has potentially nested link text in field: {1} Consider using \glsps'{'{3}'}' or \glspt'{'{3}'}' instead of {2}'{'{3}'}'

Entry ''{0}'' contains \glsadd in field: {1} Consider using a dual entry or add ''{2}'' to one of the cross-referencing fields instead. (With a dual entry type, you don''t need to link a primary to its dual with \glsadd. They are automatically dependent on each other.)
Directory not writeable: {0} Using TEXMFOUTPUT instead: {1}
Entry location conflict for formats: {0} and {1} Replacing {1} with {2}
Can''t determine parent name for entry {0}
Unsupported field: {0} (Update glossaries-extra.sty to at least version {1})
You have the --group switch on but the document hasn''t defined the ''group'' key. (Have you forgotten to use the ''record'' package option?)
Parent {0} does not occur before entry {1} so removing relationship.

Problematic entry label: {0} You document is using an old glossaries version and doesn''t seem to have used fontspec which suggests it''s not using XeLaTeX or LuaLaTeX, so you need to restrict your labels to the Basic Latin set (or switch TeX engines or upgrade glossaries.sty).
Problematic entry label: {0} Contains one or more special characters.
Can''t find target {0} for aliased entry {1}. Aliased entries must be in the same resource set as their target entries with option {2}={3}.
Falling back on order of definition
Falling back on order of use
Can''t determine widest level {0} entry for glossary type ''{1}''. Using fallback method.
Can''t determine widest level {0} entry for unknown glossary type. Using fallback method.
Interpreter needed to obtain fallback contents for field {0} (entry {1})
Multiple supplemental locations not supported with glossaries-extra {1}. Restricting selection to just {0}. Update to at least glossaries-extra version {2} to support multiple supplementary sources.
Unknown entry ''{0}'' in current resource set: {1}
Unknown compound entry ''{0}'' referenced in entry ''{1}''.
Maximum value of ''{0}'' exceeded. Capping at {1}.
Mismatching versions of packages {0} ({1}) and {2} ({3}). Please upgrade {2}

The ''alias'' field can''t reference its own entry (ID: {0}).
Unable to read version date for package {0}
Package {0} version {1} is too old. Minimum version {2} required.
No information about the {0} package was found in {1}. Check your document has loaded {0}.sty and rerun LaTeX.
Unknown TeX charset: {0} Defaulting to {1}. Use {2} to set another encoding.
The aux file charset was set to {0} but this conflicts with the information found in the aux file that indicates encoding {1}.
Missing \{0} in aux file. (Have you used \{1}?)
Missing \{0} in aux file. (Have you used \{1} or \{2}?)
No records found in aux file. Have you used the glossaries-extra.sty ''record'' option? Have you indexed your entries using commands like \gls?
Missing \{0} in aux file (make sure glossaries-extra.sty is at least {1}).
Aux file not supplied or an option is missing its argument. {0}
Can''t parse {0}: may not be {1} encoded. (Try a different encoding with {2} or {3}.)
File not found: {0} (Did you forget to use the ''src'' key?)
Invalid sort method ''{0}'' given in option: {1}
Invalid value for: {0} Value must be a list of size {2,number}
Invalid {0} found in {1} (value should be a sequence of characters only)
Invalid {0} found in {1} (value should be a sequence of commands only)
Invalid value ''{0}'' for option {1} (value should be a single command)
Invalid entry type ''{0}'' provided in option ''{1}''
Invalid substitution ''{0}'' provided in option ''{1}'' (required syntax: '{'regex'}{'replacement'}')
Invalid syntax for option ''{0}'': misplaced {1} before {2}
Invalid field override option ''{0}''. Expected 'o' or 'n'
Regular expression or comparison expected after {0}
Expected one of {0} after ''{1}'' but found ''{2}''
Invalid condition, NULL test can only be used with ''='' or ''<>'', found ''{0}'' after {1}
Invalid condition, numeric test required with {0}, found {1}
Expected field or condition or string or match group reference, found ''{0}''
Expected field or condition or string or match group reference, found ''{0}'' after: {1}
Expected field or string concatenation in argument of {0}, found: {1}

Unexpected content ''{0}'' in the argument of {1}
Unable to open input stream from process: {0}
Entry can''t be its own parent: {0}
Nested location range: {0} Outer range started with: {1}
Inconsistent location format {0} with range started by {1}
''field-aliases'' can''t contain both ''{0}={1}'' and ''{2}={0}'' (trails not permitted)
Cyclic reference category='{'same as type'}' and type='{'same as category'}'
Package ''{0}'' doesn't have in-built support. Use {1} {0} to allow the interpreter to parse {0}.sty if the package isn''t too complicated.
Package ''{0}'' has in-built support. Use {1} {0} instead.
Attempt to create missing parent ''{0}'' for entry ''{1}'' caused a problem: {2}
Selection setting ''{0}'' requires previous selections from other resource sets.
''{0}'' option may only be used as a command line switch
Skipping empty field name (original label ''{0}''). Adjust the mapping with {1} to map to a valid name.
Skipping empty field name (original label ''{0}'', mapped label ''{1}''). Adjust the mapping with {2} to map to a valid name.
Too many arguments. Use {0} for help.
{0} <iso tag> Use language resource file given by <iso tag> for messages.
{1}, {0} <list> Ignore the fields identified by their source label in the comma-separated <list>.
{1}, {0} <mappings> Add source field identifiers to bib field name mappings (cumulative).
{0} <setting> Specify the case-change to apply to field labels. (Allowed settings: {1})
Parse LaTeX source code and convert glossary entry definitions (provided by glossaries.sty and glossaries-extra.sty) to bib format suitable for {0}.
{1}, {0} Split entries into separate files according to type field.
{1}, {0} Split entries into separate files according to category field.
{0} <mappings> Add internal field label to key mappings (cumulative).
Parse LaTeX source code and convert datatool.sty databases to bib format suitable for {0}.
{1}, {0} <col-key> Use column identified by <col-key> for the entry label. (Default {2})
{1}, {0} <col-key> Use column identified by <col-key> as a fallback for the entry label. (Default {2})
{1}, {0} auto-generate entry label instead of using a column.
{0} <prefix> prefix to use for auto-generate entry labels.
{0} <suffix> Save datum value in separate field with given suffix.
{0} <suffix> Save datum currency symbol in separate field with given suffix.
{0} Split entries into separate files according to database.
{0} Adjust labels in commands like \gls from field values.
{0} Strip known case-changing commands from field values.
{0} <field> Sets the name of the database field.
{0} <field> Sets the name of the dependency field (only applicable with {1}).
{0} Attempt to determine if the entry type should be set to symbol or number.
{0} <lang-tag> Identify the language tag for detecting or parsing numeric values.
